intro: Dasyphyllum leiocephalum, commonly known as the smooth-headed dasyphyllum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stamen, making it visually striking. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
